column2: The military engineers of China are known to produce some of the finest weapons of war, where the equally skilled arbalests can equipped with them. Here they can practice with their powerful crossbows.
A site for alchemy outside the city walls. Here monks will prepare many chemical elixirs for medicinal or magical purposes.
A site for alchemy inside the castle itself. Here a personal Alchemist will work on chemical elixirs for both warfare and medicine.
These fearless warriors of the Samurai order are trained here. Covered in armor head to toe, they represent ideal lifestyle of that of a warrior in Japan.

The reformed Ainu faith has a Holy Book with a creation myth, chapters on the Kamuis. The church also has a standardized liturgy and a formal church hierarchy led by the High Priest, who can be vassalized by secular rulers. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! There is always a High Priest, even if unlanded
§Y*§! Can raid neighbors for loot
§Y*§! The High Priest can call Great Holy Wars

The Ainu paganism is an animistic religion, believing that everything in nature has a kamui (spirit or god) on the inside. The most important include Kamui Fuchi, goddess of the hearth, Kim-un Kamui, god of bears and mountains, and Repun Kamui, god of the sea, fishing, and marine animals. They believe their spirits are immortal, and that their spirits will be rewarded hereafter by ascending to "kamui mosir" (land of the gods). The Ainu believe the bear is very special because the bear is Kim-un Kamui's way of delivering the gift of bear hide and meat to people. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! Can raid neighbors for loot
§Y*§! Low-tech non-pagans have very low Supply Limit in Pagan counties
§Y*§! Rulers cannot declare Holy Wars
§Y*§! Inferior at conversion and vulnerable to non-pagan missionaries
§Y*§! Rulers lose Prestige if at peace for too long
§Y*§! The Ainu Pagan faith can be Reformed

By taking the various elements of Taoism, Confucianism, and even Buddhism, the reformed Shenist faith has a standardized Holy Book and liturgy, and a formal church hierarchy led by the High Priest, who can be vassalized by secular rulers. In the game, Shenists get a slight bonus to Diplomacy, Martial, and Stewardship. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! There is always a High Priest, even if unlanded
§Y*§! Shenists get a slight Diplomacy, Martial, and Stewardship bonuses
§Y*§! Can raid neighbors for loot
§Y*§! The High Priest can call Great Holy Wars
§Y*§! Can designate any valid offspring as the heir

Shenism, Wuism, or Nuoism, is the folk religion of China with multitudes of doctrines and practices. Due to its sheer size and spread, it has influenced if not founded the other local folk religions of both Far East and South East Asia. Its widespread beliefs has resulted in more organized forms of the religion such as Confucianism and Taoism. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! Can raid neighbors for loot
§Y*§! Can declare Subjugation Wars against all other pagans
§Y*§! Rulers are limited to Gavelkind Succession
§Y*§! Rulers cannot declare Holy Wars
§Y*§! Inferior at conversion and vulnerable to non-pagan missionaries

Shinto, also "kami-no-michi" (way of the gods), is the reformed faith of the indigenous religion of Japan with influences from Chinese religions and Buddhism in particular. It teaches that certain deeds create a kind of ritual impurity which one should want to have cleansed for one's own peace of mind and good fortune rather than a negative connotation of such impurity. A lot of the religious aspect focuses on ritual practices to establish a connection between one self and their ancestors. In the game, Shinto followers get a significant bonus to Intrigue, meaning that court life becomes significantly more dangerous. Defining features in-game:n§Y*§! Can declare limited Holy Wars against non-Chinese religions
§Y*§! The head of the Shinto faith are the Emperor of Japan
§Y*§! Shintos get a hefty Intrigue bonus
§Y*§! Can designate any valid offspring as the heir
This character is a descendant of Amaterasu, who was the Sun Goddess to the Shinto belief.
column3: Ce personnage est un descendant du Amaterasu, qui était le sauveur du monde et la sainte icône selon la croyance zoroastrienne.
column4: Dieser Charakter ist der Nachkomme des Amaterasu, dem Retter der Welt laut zoroastrischen Glaubens.
column6: Este personaje es un descendiente de Amaterasu, que era el salvador del mundo según la creencia de Zoroastro.

column2:
Also known as Koshinto, it was the original indigenous religion of Japan during the Jomon period. Predating the word 'Shinto' itself, very little is known about the religion, though it may be related to the Ainu religion and also may have been sort of monotheistic, having a deity named Su-Kami. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! Can raid neighbors for loot
§Y*§! Can declare Subjugation Wars against all other pagans
§Y*§! Rulers are limited to Gavelkind Succession
§Y*§! Rulers cannot declare Holy Wars
§Y*§! Inferior at conversion and vulnerable to non-pagan missionaries

Syncretised with Chinese and Indian religions, the reformed Muist faith has a standardized Holy Book and liturgy, and a formal church hierarchy led by the High Priest, who can be vassalized by secular rulers. In the game, Muists get a slight bonus to Diplomacy, Stewardship, and Learning. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! There is always a High Priest, even if unlanded
§Y*§! Muists get a slight Diplomacy, Stewardship, and Learning bonuses
§Y*§! Can raid neighbors for loot
§Y*§! The High Priest can call Great Holy Wars
§Y*§! Can designate any valid offspring as the heir

Muism, or Sinism, is the pre-historic shamanistic folk religion of Korea. Purity is important to the rituals performed, called gut involving taking purified wine and burning white paper. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! Can raid neighbors for loot
§Y*§! Can declare Subjugation Wars against all other pagans
§Y*§! Rulers are limited to Gavelkind Succession
§Y*§! Rulers cannot declare Holy Wars
§Y*§! Inferior at conversion and vulnerable to non-pagan missionaries

Syncretised with the Chinese religions and the Japanese Shinto, the reformed Ryukyuan faith has a standardized Holy Book and liturgy, and a formal church hierarchy led by the High Priest, who can be vassalized by secular rulers. In the game, Ryukyuans get a slight bonus to Diplomacy, Martial, Intrigue, and Stewardship. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! There is always a High Priest, even if unlanded
§Y*§! Ryukyuans get a slight Diplomacy, Martial, Intrigue, and Stewardship bonuses
§Y*§! Can raid neighbors for loot
§Y*§! The High Priest can call Great Holy Wars
§Y*§! Can designate any valid offspring as the heir

The Ryukyuan religion is an indigenous belief system to the people of the Ryukyu Islands having animistic roots. Though similar to the Japanese Shinto religion, Ryukyuans believe in the concept of "onarigami", meaning the spiritual superiority of women in stark contrast to Shinto. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! Can raid neighbors for loot
§Y*§! Can declare Subjugation Wars against all other pagans
§Y*§! Rulers are limited to Gavelkind Succession
§Y*§! Rulers cannot declare Holy Wars
§Y*§! Inferior at conversion and vulnerable to non-pagan missionaries

Syncretised with organized religions, the reformed Thanist faith has a standardized Holy Book and liturgy, and a formal church hierarchy led by the High Priest, who can be vassalized by secular rulers. In the game, Thanists get a slight bonus to Diplomacy, Martial, and Learning. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! There is always a High Priest, even if unlanded
§Y*§! Thanists get a slight Diplomacy, Martial, and Learning bonuses
§Y*§! Can raid neighbors for loot
§Y*§! The High Priest can call Great Holy Wars
§Y*§! Can designate any valid offspring as the heir

Thanism is the folk religion of the Viet people as well as the Cham and Khmer people. Having a lot of similarities with the various Chinese religions, Thanism incorporates various local traditions thus tends to be diverse in ways of practice. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! Can raid neighbors for loot
§Y*§! Can declare Subjugation Wars against all other pagans
§Y*§! Rulers are limited to Gavelkind Succession
§Y*§! Rulers cannot declare Holy Wars
§Y*§! Inferior at conversion and vulnerable to non-pagan missionaries
This character, though neither Confucian, Amidist or Taoist, has a special sympathy and understanding for the Daoic faiths and their practitioners.
column3: Ce personnage, bien qu'il ne soit pas confucéenne, amidiste ou taoïste, montre une sympathie et une compréhension envers les cultes daoique et leurs adeptes.
column4: Der Charakter, obwohl weder Konfuzianer, Amidist oder Taoist, hegt eine besondere Sympatie und Verständnis für daoische Religionen und ihre Jünger.
column6: Este personaje, aunque no es Confuciano, ni Amidista o Taoísta, tiene una especial simpatía y conocimiento de la fe Daoas y sus seguidores.

column2: This character follows the Ethics of Benevolence.
This character follows the Ethics of Proper Rite.
This character follows the Ethics of Loyalty.
This character follows the Ethics of Filial Piety.
Tao is respected by the clergy and monastics of your religion. Like Prestige, it is added to your score on the death of a ruler.

Amidism represents the two schools of Buddhism in East Asia: Buddhasektra and Dhyana. The main theological focus of the school is on the Amitabha Buddha, a diety that is said to possess infinite merits resulting from good deeds over countless past lives. Amidist teachings were first developed in India, and were very popular in Kashmir and Central Asia where they may have originated. Amidism often incorporates elements of Confucianism, Taoism, or even Shenism as well. In the game, Amidists get a significant bonus to Martial, meaning that they will be capable at war better. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! There is no religious head
§Y*§! Amidists get a hefty Martial bonus
§Y*§! Can declare Subjugation Wars against all Chinese religions
§Y*§! Can declare limited Holy Wars against non-Chinese religions
§Y*§! Hard to convert Confucian and Taoist counties.
§Y*§! Can designate any valid offspring as the heir
This character follows the Buddhaksetra branch of Amidism.
column3: Ce personnage suit la branche buddhaksetra du amidisme.
column4: Der Charakter folgt Buddhaksetra des Amidismus
column6: Este personaje sigue la rama Buddhaksetra del Amidismo.

column2: This character follows the Dhyana branch of Amidism.
column3: Ce personnage suit la branche dhyana du amidisme.
column4: Der Charakter folgt dem Dhyanazweig des Amidismus
column6: Este personaje sigue la rama Dhyana del Amidismo.

column2:
Confucianism was found by the Chinese philosopher, Confucius, in China in the 5th century B.C. The religion flourished not only China, but also heavily influenced society in other parts of East Asia such as Korea, Japan, and Vietnam. In the game, Confucians get a significant bonus to Diplomacy, meaning that they are likely to be very stable. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! There is no religious head
§Y*§! Confucians get a hefty Diplomacy bonus
§Y*§! Cannot declare Holy Wars
§Y*§! Can declare Subjugation Wars against all Chinese religions
§Y*§! Hard to convert Amidist and Taoist counties
§Y*§! Can designate any valid offspring as the heir

Neo-Confucianism or Lixue, was an attempt to create a rationalistic and secular form of Confucianism, rejecting superstitious and mystical elements of Buddhist and Toaist influence, though it borrowed terms and concepts from both. In the game, Confucians get a slight bonus to Diplomacy, Martial, and Stewardship. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! There is no religious head
§Y*§! Confucians get a slight Diplomacy, Martial, and Stewardship bonuses
§Y*§! Cannot declare Holy Wars
§Y*§! Can declare Subjugation Wars against all Chinese religions
§Y*§! Can designate any valid offspring as the heir

Taoism or Daoism, is philosophical, ethical, and religious tradition originating from China which emphasizes living in harmony with the Tao. Tao, which means 'way', 'path', or 'principle', is found in other philosophies and religions, but Taoism dictates that it is the source and driving force being everything that exists thus: "The Tao that can be told is not the eternal Tao". In the game, Taoists get a significant bonus to Stewardship, meaning that they can significantly improve their economy. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! There is no religious head
§Y*§! Taoists get a hefty Stewardship bonus
§Y*§! Cannot declare Holy Wars
§Y*§! Can declare Subjugation Wars against all Chinese religions
§Y*§! Hard to convert Amidist and Confucian counties
§Y*§! Can designate any valid offspring as the heir
This character follows the Way of Right Oneness.
This character follows the Way of Fulfilled Virtue.

Neo-Taoism or Xuanxue, is a combination of Confucianism and Taoism with the re-interpretation of key texts. In the game, Taoists get a significant slight to Diplomacy and Stewardship, meaning that they can significantly improve their economy. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! There is no religious head
§Y*§! Taoists get a slight Diplomacy and Stewardship bonuses
§Y*§! Cannot declare Holy Wars
§Y*§! Can declare Subjugation Wars against all Chinese religions
§Y*§! Hard to convert Amidist and Confucian counties
§Y*§! Can designate any valid offspring as the heir
